Comment: It would be the right thing to do to keep the cost of so much of what we buy from skyrocketing. But alas, Trump isn't welknown for *ever* doing the right thing.
Author: invalidpassword

Comment: I don't think people understand how bad it's going to get in coming months unless Trump tries to unring that tariff bell ASAP. The summer months will get ugly quickly, with empty store shelves, quickly rising food prices, and lots of small businesses going under. And it's going to be exacerbated by the massive downturn in tourism to the United States.  And those shipping channels take time to restore. You're not turning them on immediately just by removing tariffs. It'll take months to fully ramp things up if we allow them to stop.   It's still mostly avoidable at this point, but given Trump's track record I'm not optimistic on him swallowing his pride and cancelling the tariffs.
Author: supes1

Comment: Rebooting these global supply chains will take months. The stock in the system is running down and won't currently be replenished. Look at any of the ports/shipping/trucking data - everything China-US is pretty much at a standstill.  The US is facing empty shelves and shut down domestic factories in weeks and there is literally nothing that can be done to stop it.  The longer he dicks around with Tariffs the bigger and longer the impact will be.  Trump has already lost the trade war, like a plane when the wings fall off it just hasn't hit the ground yet.
